expands.title: How much do you charge?
expands.content:
I just want to do something meaningful and pay my bills at the same time, while also taking care of my physical and mental health. Is that so much to ask?

Back before I went full Tyler Durden on my life in 2016 I was making $140k per year.

Despite socialist leanings, I don't believe that the acquisition of small-scale wealth is inherently evil. And for this reason, all else equal, $140k per year is the minimum I want to be compensated going forward for full-time work.

That said, all else is never equal. I will always prioritize health and meaning over income. So if you're doing something you think I'd like - regardless of your budget - I'd love to talk.

For contract work, I charge $125/hr, with discounts for projects spanning one month or longer.

expands.title: Will you work for equity?
expands.content:
Yes! Happily. And frankly, I find it a little suspicious that most won't.

Given that Iâ€™m a risk-tolerant guy with ultra low expenses and zero dependents... there are only three reasons why I wouldn't accept equity.

1. I don't believe in your project's mission.
2. I don't believe in your project's ability to make money.
3. I don't believe in you or your team.

In all three of those cases... I should say no to your project. Right?

So, yeah, I'm happy to put ~~my~~ your money where my mouth is. I need to be paid a minimum of **$2,500/month** in order to live comfortably, but am happy to accept some or all of the remaining payment in the form of equity.
